ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, tà pi júʼ nyìŋ gɔɔn ngie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a áa na ye, pi gwóon ńzẅíŋ zẅíŋ, té cwoŋo ńdíe ka áa kwàʼ Zẅìge Ssé wɔ́ɔ. Á nue pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò pǔ ńgyɔ́ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tɛʼ.
en: Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits   to see if they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ge lɔg zsé Zẅìge gie á fóo mbwó Ssé ayɔɔn: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô Keleto la sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ kwàʼ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mbà ngàŋ gẅiin Zẅìge gie á fóo mbwó Ssé.
en: This is how you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh   is from God,  # 4:2 1Co 12:3

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńdʉʼʉ lézẅíŋ ngie Yěsô Keleto la tó ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mbà ngàŋ te gẅiin Zẅìge gie á fóo mbwó Ssé wɔ́, ayé Zẅìge áa gie á fóo mbwó ngàŋmbù Keleto gẅie pi la júʼ mé gɔɔn ngie à ne ńtóo. À kéen ńké ńdáʼ ńtó tà ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: but every spirit that does not confess Jesus   is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist,  # 4:3 1Jn 2:18,22; 2Jn 7 which you have heard is coming; even now it is already in the world.

ngiemboon: Pi penkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi ee na gwoŋó ye Ssé. Pi kéen ńdÿɔ́ʼ tà ńcʉa pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò, mélàʼmie à Zẅìge Ssé gie áa na pi, á pú ńtʉ ńcʉa ngàŋmbù Keleto gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: You are from God, little children, and you have conquered them, because the one who is in you   is greater than the one who is in the world.  # 4:4 Jn 12:31

ngiemboon: Pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ̌nò, ée na gwoŋó ye pʉ̀a njÿó. Áa mmó gie á gÿo pɔ́ zíʼi shúm é gwɔ́ pɔ́ se tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, epʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó piŋ ńzẅíʼte yɔ́b nò.
en: They are from the world.   Therefore what they say is from the world, and the world listens to them.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pege, mbà pege ee na gwoŋó ye Ssé. Nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńzsé Ssé à ne ńzẅíʼte nò gie pege gɔɔn. Nyìŋ gẅie à te na gwǒŋ ye Ssé wɔ́, à te yégè nò zẅíʼte. Pege fó pɔ́ púʼu, tá ńzsé nò nénʉ́, ńzsé cÿɔ̌nò.
en: We are from God. Anyone who knows God listens to us;   anyone who is not from God does not listen to us. This is how we know the Spirit of truth and the spirit of deception.  # 4:6 Mk 13:5–6; 1Co 2:12; 1Tm 4:1

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, pege gẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, á nue nkwòŋe fóo mbwó Ssé. Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin nkwòŋe aa míŋ Ssé, ńne ńzsé Ssé
en: Dear friends, let us love one another, because love is from God, and everyone who loves has been born of God   and knows God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn te nyìŋ mesoŋ kwoŋ, mbà à nyě te zsě Ssé, á nue e Ssé gẅiin pɔ́ nkwòŋe.
en: The one who does not love does not know God, because God is love.

ngiemboon: Anò gie Ssé la lɔg ńnyɛɛ wégè ngie à kwoŋo wégè ayɔɔn: à la túm ndàʼ Míŋ we wémɔʼɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ngie pege cʉa nzèm yé ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: God’s love was revealed among us   in this way: God sent  # 4:9 Mk 9:37 his one and only Son  # 4:9 Jn 1:14,18; 3:16,18 into the world so that we might live  # 4:9 Jn 10:28 through him.

ngiemboon: Nkwòŋe léen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼɔɔn, pege zɔ la te kwoŋ Ssé wɔ́, yé zɔ la kwoŋo wégè. À la kwoŋo wégè kwoŋ tà ńtúmo Míŋ we, á tó ńdɔgɔ twó yé, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ ńtí wégè, áa mmó gie á gÿo, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mégè.
en: Love consists in this: not that we loved God, but that he loved us   and sent his Son to be the atoning sacrifice  # 4:10 Or the propitiation,# 4:10 2Co 5:21; 1Jn 2:2 for our sins.

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn petʉ̀nzẅìŋ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la kwoŋo wégè páʼɔɔn, mbà á ne ńzɛ́te ngie pege yégè gẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: Dear friends, if God loved us in this way, we also must love one another.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à lǎ záb lejÿɔ́g na Ssé à te wó wɔ́. Tá ńgwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn ńgẅiin nkwòŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, mbà peg lâ Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́, nkwòŋe ye lɔgɔ ńcwoŋo ńgwɔ́ na pege tà mmó té zága mǒ wɔ́.
en: No one has ever seen God.   If we love one another, God remains in  # 4:12 Or remains among us and his love is made complete in us.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á gÿo pege zsé ngie pege la nnɛ́ na Ssé, e Ssé la nnɛ́ na pege, áa páʼ à la náa Zẅìge yé né pege.
en: This is how we know that we remain in him   and he in us: He has given us of his Spirit.  # 4:13 Rv 3:22

ngiemboon: Peg la lɔg nÿɔ́g még ńgyá tà ngwɔ́ gɔɔn páʼɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ panjÿòngyá na páʼ à la túmo Míŋ we, páʼ à ge gʉa gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ge gʉa gÿo pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tsẅɛ́.
en: And we have seen and we testify that the Father has sent his Son   as the world’s Savior.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô aa Míŋ Ssé, mbà Ssé lǎ nnɛ́ na ngàŋ, angàŋ gíŋe ńda ye nnɛ́ na Ssé.
en: Whoever confesses   that Jesus is the Son of God #— #God remains in him and he in God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na peg, mbà pɔ́ ne ńzsé páʼ Ssé kwoŋo wég púʼu, peg ka gyá yɛ̌ ntí nkwòŋe tà ńzẅíŋ.
en: And we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔɔn ńgẅiin nkwòŋe ntʉ́m pege tà tsɔ́ mmó té mǒ zág, pege é le kwaŋte lyɛʼɛ́ létsɔ́ʼte mentsaŋ ntʉ́m wégè vɛ wɔ́. Púʼu, mélàʼmie wege lénéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó yɔɔn aa páʼ we Yěsô Keleto.
en: In this, love is made complete with us so that we may have confidence in the day of judgment,   because as he is, so also are we in this world.  # 4:17 Jn 14:10–11; 15:9–10; 17:11,15,18

ngiemboon: Nkwòŋe vɔg tà ńgwɔ́ ssé, ecÿɔʼ mag. Nkwòŋe lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà tsɔ́ mmó té mǒ zág, é pyága lecÿɔʼ, nyìŋ gwaa cÿɔʼ, mbà à fʉ̌a nò tà ne ḿbɔ́gɔ. Púʼu la, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńcÿɔʼ, mbà á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie ammó nyé ńzága na nkwòŋe gie à gẅiin.
en: There is no fear in love; instead, perfect love drives out fear,   because fear involves punishment.  # 4:18 Or fear has its own punishment or torment So the one who fears is not complete in love.  # 4:18 Eph 4:11–16

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na peg, peg kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, á gwɔ́ mélàʼmie e Ssé la vɔg ńkwoŋo wég.
en: We love   because he first loved us.  # 4:19 2Th 2:13

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie à ne ńkwoŋo Ssé, ńgwɔ́ gɔɔn púʼu, ńne ḿbʉa fɛ̌ we, mbà aa ngàŋa cÿɔ̌nò. Á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn te kwoŋo fɛ̌ we gẅie à ne ńgyá yé wɔ́, á le kuʼu lékwoŋ Ssé gie à te ne ńgyá yé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: If anyone says, “I love God,” and yet hates his brother or sister,   he is a liar.  # 4:20 1Jn 1:10 For the person who does not love his brother or sister  # 4:20 1Jn 2:10; 3:10,14–17 whom he has seen cannot love God whom he has not seen.  # 4:20 Other mss read has seen, how is he able to love . . . seen? (as a question)

ngiemboon: Lepʉ̌ sie Keleto la ná né pege, é sɔɔn: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkwoŋ Ssé, á gíŋe ńkwoŋo fɛ̌ we nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: And we have this command from him: The one who loves God must also love his brother and sister.
